snippet: New businesses are showing encouraging growth, but they are not yet large or profitable enough to offset challenges in the company’s traditional strengths.
abstract: IBM reports fourth-quarter net income of $5.5 billion, down 11 percent from year-earlier period, as revenue slides to $24.1 billion from $27.7 billion; results reflect company's transition to new businesses that are not yet profitable while shedding traditional assets that drove sales.
lead_paragraph: New businesses are showing encouraging growth, but they are not yet large or profitable enough to offset challenges in the company’s traditional strengths.

headline.main: IBM Revenue Slides as Revamping Takes Hold
headline.print_headline: IBM Sales Slide, Largely by Design, as a Transition of Uncertain Duration Goes On
